snippet: For New York City’s 2013 contest, Hurricane Sandy has stirred up unexpected topics and a new set of class and interborough tensions.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy stirs up unexpected topics and an unfamiliar set of class and interborough tensions that may affect New York City's 2013 mayoral race; candidates are facing questions on sea gates and tidal marshes, exotic topics that were never in their briefing books, as minutiae of federal disaster relief and reaction to the storm is suddenly in headlines.
lead_paragraph: For New York City’s 2013 contest, Hurricane Sandy has stirred up unexpected topics and a new set of class and interborough tensions.

headline.seo: Hurricane Sandy Alters Mayoral Campaigns in N.Y.C.
headline.main: Storm Writes a New Script in Campaigns for New York Mayor
headline.print_headline: Storm Writes A New Script In Campaigns For Mayor
